children.name: RequestActor
children.description: This is a special actor and needs to be instantiated with the special id **`proxy/request`**

discard_headers.description: a list of request header names that need to be discarded immediately

connect_timeout.description: timeout for the connection process in milliseconds

socket_timeout.description: timeout for silent socket in milliseconds

redirects_enabled.description: set to true if you want AFtheM to resolve redirects instead of forwarding to the client

max_redirects.description: if redirects are enabled, maximum number of redirects before giving up

discard_headers.description: a list of response header names that need to be discarded immediately

children.name: UpstreamFileActor
children.description: An upstream actor that pulls content from text files.

basepath.description: path to the files directory. The file name needs to be provided in the request url

children.name: SendBackActor
children.description: An actor taking care of performing the final checks, packaging and sending back the content.

children.name: AccessLoggerActor
children.description:
A logger actor meant to log both inbound and outbound calls.
The behavior of the logging activity is managed by the `etc/logback.xml` file.

children.name: GenericLoggerActor
children.description:
A logger to be used in a flow to log certain facts, determined by the user.
The behavior of the logging activity is managed by the `etc/logback.xml` file.

children.name: FileAppenderSerializerActor
children.description: Serializes a full API conversation to JSON and appends it to a file.

disable_on_header.description: if the provided header is present in the request, then the conversation will skip serialization

enable_on_header.description: if the provided header is present in the request, then the conversation will be serialized

discard_request_headers.description: list of request headers that should not appear in the serialized conversation

discard_response_headers.description: list of response headers that should not appear in the serialized conversation

allow_content_types.description: full or partial response content types which make the request eligible for serialization. If

config.description: the list is null or empty, all content types will be accepted

children.name: TransformHeadersActor
children.description:
Alters the headers of a message. If the transformer is placed before an Upstream actor, it modifies the request headers.

children.name: FilterActor
children.description: Filters out any request not matching a certain set of criteria.

accept.description: a list of conditions. If verified, the message will be accepted.

config.description: Just like previous filters, if evaluated is true,`value` will be evaluated as SpEL script.

reject.description: a list of conditions. If verified, the message will be rejected.
